content.question: Students are doing an experiment near an empty pool. A student of mass <math alttext="40 kilograms" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>40</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.4em"></mspace><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mi>k</mi><mi>g</mi></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> is standing on one end of a board as the board hangs over the pool as shown. The board is of uniform density, has a length <math alttext="L" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>L</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>, and is positioned such that the pivot point is <math alttext="L over 3" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>L</mi><mo>/</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> from the end of the board. The board is just about to tip over into the pool. How far from the pivot point must a <math alttext="60 kilogram" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>60</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.4em"></mspace><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mi>k</mi><mi>g</mi></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> student stand so that the board is just about to tip over?

skill.text: 2.D: Predict new values or factors of change of physical quantities using functional dependence between variables.
